page.title: 10Mrs Neal's Pigeons in School
page.content: Mrs Neal's hobby is breeding,racing and keeping pigeons. She feeds her pigeons on dried peas,sweet corn and beans. They have water to drink. One of her pigeons is called Sidney. Sidney has won races. Mrs Neal has forty-eight pigeons altogether and keeps them in a pigeon loft. They lay their eggs in February or March. They lay two eggs - the second one the day after the first. Mrs Neal brought some of her pigeons for Class 3 of All Saints School Dovercourt to see. Class 3 were told that pigeons can see twenty miles in the daytime but only two inches at night. She showed the children how to ring a pigeon's foot and explained how to time a pigeon in a race. This was an exciting lesson as part of a project on birds.
